snippet: The United Nations’ top human rights official has urged African members to prosecute what he called longstanding abuse allegations by troops sent to keep the peace in the Central African Republic.
abstract: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, United Nations high commissioner for human rights, calls on several African member states to prosecute allegations of abuses by peacekeeping troops they had sent to Central African Republic in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations’ top human rights official has urged African members to prosecute what he called longstanding abuse allegations by troops sent to keep the peace in the Central African Republic.

headline.main: African Countries Are Urged to Investigate Reports of Abuse by Peacekeepers
headline.print_headline: U.N. Urges More Scrutiny of Peacekeepers in Africa

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
